title: No Return Hub
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:foxtrot
overwatch=a|
dark=a|
wide=a|
hidetitle=a]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:fade-in speed=1]]

[[module css]]
:root {
    --head-font: var(--ui-font);
}

.bubble {
    align: center;
    width: auto;
    margin-left: 3px;
    margin-right: 3px;
    --link-txt-color: rgb(var(--accent));
    background-color: var(--dark-bg-1);
    border: 3px solid rgb(var(--accent));
    border-radius: 12px;
    padding: 10px;
}

.brief {
    align: center;
    width: 66%;
    margin: auto;
    --link-txt-color: var(--dark-bg-1);
    background-color: rgb(var(--accent));
    border-radius: 12px;
    padding: 12px;
}
.brief :is(h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6) {
    color: var(--dark-bg-1) !important;
}

.cards {
    display: flex;
    flex-wrap: nowrap;
    justify-content: space-around;
    align-items: flex-start;
    flex-direction: row;
    align-content: center;
}

.cards > div {
    margin: -12px;
}

.cards a {
    border-bottom: none !important;
}

@media (min-width: 768px) {
    #main-content {
       max-width: 98%;
    }

    .mb {
        display: none;
    }
}

@media (max-width: 767px) {
    .custom {
        font-size: 60%;
    }

    .dt {
        display: none;
    }

    .cards {
        margin: 0px !important;
    }
}

.graybox {
    --accent: 204, 204, 204;
}

.greenbox {
    --accent: 68, 187, 34;
}

.custom2 {
    width: auto !important;
    margin: 0px;
    padding: 0px;
}
[[/module]]

[[=]]
[[module Rate]]

@@ @@

[[div class="modal" style="max-width: 300px; margin: auto; font-style: italic; padding: .2em;"]]
A single choice begets two worlds,
A mirrored tapestry unfurls;
Vanguard's aegis shines
As Threshold draws the line
Of ...
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=image https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/local--files/grigori-karpin-s-author-page/TestNoReturn style="width: 100%;"]]

@@ @@

[[div class="notation"]]
A multiversal degradation in anomalous phenomena ravages the world of magic, leaving its fantastical hidden lands and communities to gradually die out; the Foundation, its allies and foes, are made painfully aware that //something// must change. Explore //the Impasse// and the nuanced relationship between the Foundation, the anomalous, and the nature of change itself. Examine the world at stake and decide, ultimately, how to bring it hope.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[div class="fancyhr"]]
----
[[/div]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble" style="margin: 0px;"]]
+ [*/scp-6500 SCP-6500] ##eee|-- INEVITABLE##
//by Aethris, Darkstuff, Grigori Karpin, HarryBlank, Ihp, Placeholder McD, S D Locke//

Follow the Foundation's path to combat the Impasse by following several individuals on their own Paths through dying magic realms to retrieve artefacts of elemental power. Choose how they are wielded, for better or worse.

@@ @@

[[div class="brief"]]
+ [*/scp-6500/offset/0 DEPARTURE]
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="custom"]]
[[div class="cards" style="width: 100%; margin: auto;"]]

[[div]]
[[f=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/warriorcard.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/1" width="100%"]]
++ ##aaa|WARRIOR##
//by HarryBlank//
[[/div]]

[[div]]
[[f=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/magecard.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/2" width="100%"]]
++ ##f24|MAGE##
//by Ihp//
[[/div]]

[[div]]
[[f=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/clericcard.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/4" width="100%"]]
++ ##2bf|CLERIC##
//by Grigori Karpin//
[[/div]]

[[div]]
[[f=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/thiefcard.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/5" width="100%"]]
++ ##4b2|THIEF##
//by DarkStuff//
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/pariahcard.png width="100%" style="padding: 0 !important; margin: 0 !important;" link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/10"]]
+ PARIAH
//by Placeholder McD//

@@ @@

[[div class="cards" style="width: 100%; margin: auto;"]]
[[div class="cards" style="width: 50%;"]]

[[div]]
[[f=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/warlockcard.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/13" width="100%"]]
++ ##teal|WARLOCK##
//by HarryBlank//
[[/div]]

[[div]]
[[f=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/reliquarianscard.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/14" width="100%"]]
++ [[span style="filter: brightness(166%);"]][[span class="dt"]]##maroon|RELIQUARIANS##[[/span]][[span class="mb"]]##maroon|RELIQ.##[[/span]][[/span]]
//by Ihp//
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

[[div class="cards" style="width: 50%; padding-left: 1.25%;"]]

[[div]]
[[f=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/voyagercard.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/15" width="100%"]]
++ ##a1f|VOYAGER##
//by Placeholder McD//
[[/div]]

[[div]]
[[f=image https://scp-wiki.wdfiles.com/local--files/fragment%3Ascp-6500-2/emmissarycard.png link="https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6500/offset/16" width="100%"]]
++ [[span style="border: 4px #4b2 solid; background: #4b2; color: black;"]]EMISSARY[[/span]]
//by Grigori Karpin//
[[/div]]

[[/div]]

[[/div]]

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="brief"]]
+ [*/scp-6500/offset/17 CROSSROADS]
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[/div]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[div class="fancyhr"]]
----
[[/div]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[div class="brief"]]
++++ //PRIMARY POST-PIVOT WORKS//
[[/div]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[div class="cards custom custom2"]]
[[div class="graybox" style="width: 50%;"]]
[[div class="brief"]]
++ THRESHOLD TIMELINE
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/nobody-likes-a-sneak Nobody Likes a Sneak]
//by Grigori Karpin//

A streetwise //Nobody// searching for an explanation for the [*/scp-6500 Impasse], starts up an investigation that runs her afoul of cognitohazards, T-rex skeletons, the Wanderer’s Library, and a Paris café.  
And that’s just the beginning.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/nobody-s-looking-for-trouble Nobody's Looking For Trouble]
//by Grigori Karpin//

//Nobody// isn’t alone, she’s working with the Serpent’s Hand, and she isn’t even the only //nobody// around, but none of that is gonna matter if they can’t find out where the Foundation is holding O5-Zero after their trial.
[[/div]]
@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/nobody-came-to-the-funeral Nobody Came to the Funeral]
//by Grigori Karpin//

//Nobody//, along with Zero and the Black queen, meets with a wanderer from a different Foundational mindset (//oh shit, is that Ilse from OG43 and Path of the Voyager?//), attends a funeral for those lost, and makes plans to see where she can sink a knife to best disrupt the Foundation in the months following SCP-6500.
[[/div]]
@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-8787 SCP-8787: The Roast Not Taken]
//by Ihp//

In the aftermath of the Impasse, some anomalies haven't made a full recovery. An anomalous coffee shop, desperate to recover its strength, kidnaps a family in the Foundation. Can Dr. Sinclair break free of her new life?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-8650 SCP-8650: Mystery Science Theater 6500]
//by Ihp and LizardWizard//

The latest and greatest release from Vikander-Kneed Technical Media: Mystery Science Theater 6500!  Watch as your favorite researchers from the SCP Foundation get kidnapped to watch a movie based on the events of SCP-6500.  
You will be amazed.  
You will be awed.  
You will leave a good review.
[[/div]]
@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/a-trip-down-memory-lane A Trip Down Memory Lane]
//by HarryBlank, LizardWizard//

//You want to repurpose a formerly-hostile, presumably living anomaly, to save twelve dollars?//
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [[[Fafnir]]]
//by Ethagon//

Some always profit from the status quo. Among those is an ancient dragon that would have rather slept through the Impasse and its consequences. This is how it came to be.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/undaeveling Undaeveling]
//by Guezma//

After the Impasse is over, Judith Low updates SCP-140 to Neutralised. If only it were that easy with the Daevites.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-8297 SCP-8297: Snuffed Out]
//by UNCGriffin//

With the Impasse resolved, the status quo of the Veil is preserved.   Unfortunately, some scars never heal.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/red-pool-superfund-site UIU File: 2021-354 (OPERATION: SUPERFUND)]
//by Kothardarastrix//

Burying a problem only makes it worse.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/resurrection-of-the-purple-witch The Purple Witch Is Dead]
//by Einer von Rabe//

The Black Queen [*/pawn-to-e4 Alison], following the advice of one of her Sisters, is trying to recruit an associate -- [*http://scp-int.wikidot.com/goi-1995-de-das-wunderkabinett Ms Mirabilis], The ##b686bf|Purple Witch##. 
However, it seems that she has been hit hard by the Impasse.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

@@ @@

[[div class="brief"]]
++++ //RELATED POST-PIVOT WORKS//
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/character-interactions-disguised-as-an-epilogue Character Interactions Disguised As An Epilogue]
//by Ihp//

Technically the end of [*/nothing-to-fear-hub Black Autumn IV: Nothing to Fear] this tale begins prior to the end of SCP-6500 but then finishes after, representing a montage of 2021’s events from the perspective of [*/the-s-c-plastics-hub Site-87’s] cast of characters.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-5056/offset/1 SCP-5056 (II): The Mirror Image]
//by HarryBlank//

Philip Deering, the former SCP-5056-B, looks back with mixed feelings on one very strange year.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-5974 SCP-5974: The Interactive Fiction]
//by HarryBlank//

A Foundation traitor is forced to relive her activities in the time before the Impasse by a video game with very low user friendliness.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-6056 SCP-6056: The Crumpening]
//by HarryBlank//

In the wake of the Warlock path, some heartfelt conversations are happening -- and being rudely interrupted.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-7000 SCP-7000: The Loser]
//by HarryBlank//

William Wettle is one seriously unlucky individual, but when a //LK-Class "Twist of Fate" Probability Failure Scenario// begins cascading across the globe, the Foundation needs to utilize the good doctor’s unluckiness in a way that will put him directly in the line of fire.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-7007 SCP-7007: Misfortune Gorge]
//by Grigori Karpin and Vivarium//

Almost a year after the events of SCP-6500, [[[vikander-kneed-technical-media-hub | Vikander-Kneed Technical Media]]] have some thoughts about the Foundation's recent behavior and invite them onto a gameshow.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-8889 SCP-8889: Wondrous Wedding of William Wallace Wettle]
//by LizardWizard//

VKTM is up to their old tricks, and kidnap Dr. Wettle to… marry him? Prepare for 8 episodes of Joy, Fear, and Media.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/spc-7000 SPC-7000]
//by Uncle Nicolini and Grigori Karpin//

In the aftermath of the SCP-7000, William Wallace Wettle is kidnapped across universes by a alternative Foundation organization called SPC.  He is the secret weapon to combat the Selachian Menace.  Only Wettle can save the SPC.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[/div]]

[[div class="greenbox" style="width: 50%;"]]
[[div class="brief"]]
++ VANGUARD TIMELINE
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/dr-dan-goes-to-washington Dr. Dan Goes to Washington]
//by Grigori Karpin//

Vanguard is making its debut, revealing itself to the world and slashing the Veil in a global announcement.  And they're sending Dr. Dan.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/war-in-the-library War in the Library]
//by Grigori Karpin & LizardWizard//

The Black Queen needs to deal with an overzealous splinter cell of the Serpent's Hand during the transition between SH and Vanguard, just after Vanguard became public knowledge.  The only problem is, this conflict is happening in the middle of the Wanderers' Library.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/hour-zero Hour Zero]
//by Jasiu06 and Ralliston//

You do not seem to understand. The decision will be made, regardless of your approval.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/sarkic-heat Sarkic Heat]
//by Grigori Karpin//

Shortly after Vanguard is established, Tilda Moose asks Dr. Alto Clef and [*/scp-2075 Karcist Varis] to lead a raid on the [*/scp-2408 Hunter’s Black Lodge] in Moscow.  Think of this as a buddy cop comedy, with body horror.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/a-sarkic-by-any-other-name A Sarkic By Any Other Name]
//by Grigori Karpin//

Following up on Sarkic Heat, Varis and Clef continue their addressing of Sarkic Anomalies for the Vanguard as the heat starts to rise around [[[SCP-2480]]] and a brewing conflict with the GOC.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/an-assembly-of-sarkics An Assembly of Sarkics]
//by Grigori Karpin//

Varis calls together a meeting of Nälkän leaders, to start the process of bringing together the various tribes of Ion.  But something is bothering him, where are the other Klavigars?  Where is Lovataar?  

Varis and Clef take an MTF squad into the depths of [[[SCP-2191]]] in search of the legendary Klavigar, and things go predictably awry.
[[/div]]

@@ @@



[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/orok-and-the-orchard Orok and the Orchard]
//by Grigori Karpin//

Directly after the events of An Assembly of Sarkics, Clef and Varis visit the site of [[[SCP-3989]]] with Orok and Lucretia Popescu, so as to determine what if any connection it has with the Klavigar, and to find out even more about the wandering trail of an imposter Grand Karcist Ion through the centuries.
[[/div]]

@@ @@
[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/two-sarkics-take-a-vacation-in-polynesia-stop-me-if-youve-he Two Sarkics Take a Vacation in Polynesia, Stop Me If You've Heard This One]
//by Grigori Karpin//

Directly after the events of An Assembly of Sarkics, Lovataar and Saarn decide to pay a visit to [[[SCP-4036]]] on a diplomatic mission.  They face distrust from the locals and from each other, but ultimately face a far graver threat: Colonialism.
[[/div]]

@@ @@
[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/with-many-choices With Many Choices]
//by LizardWizard and Grigori Karpin//

As [[[SCP-939]]] is normalized, Vanguard and the GOC battle in the court of public opinion.
[[/div]]



@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/veilfall What Came After]
//by Uncle Nicolini and Grigori Karpin//

A series of vignettes cataloguing the reactions of every day people to Vanguard's reveal, and the first description of Vanguard's public announcement! Tune in for worldbuilding, but stick around for the grounded character perspective.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/list-of-common-anomalous-misconceptions List of Common Anomalous Misconceptions]
//by Guezma, Grigori Karpin, Zygard, and Blazingpie//

In light of Vanguard's appearance and the fall of the Veil, a few Wikipedia users got together to craft a list of all those misconceptions connected to the anomalous.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/god-meat-s-back-on-the-menu God meat's back on the menu]
//by Guezma//

An ancient evil in unsealed and let loose in a city. Vanguard calls in an ally whose skills are perfect to deal with the situation.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-6521 VNP-6521: Lord Mansfield outlaws Vanguard]
//by Guezma//

A stolen painting, vile schemes, and all of Vanguard and their allies are suddenly unable to act throughout the UK. All of Vanguard? No, a certain vigilante and the patron saint of betrayal can still kick ass!
[[/div]]
@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-6483 SCP-6483: The Polar Express]
//by LORDXVNV and Ralliston//

Site-120 has a new resident humanoid anomaly, and he's really getting into the Christmas Spirit.  Watch as this anomalous individual goes from containment to employment as the switch to Vanguard occurs in this holiday appropriate article. 
[[/div]]
@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-8050 VNP-8050: One to Rule Them All]
//by WarriorofChaos, UNCGriffin, Diogene_s, and Damian Thorne//

Following the Impasse, a dead artifact resurfaces. As it jumps from hand to hand, Vanguard – and Dr. Sinclair from Path of the Mage – must face the ghosts of its past to protect the future.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/scp-7629 SCP-7629: Sanctuary of The Sky Keepers] 
//by WarriorofChaos//

Site-120 discovers the hidden underground remnants of an ancient and powerful race, one who roots to the origin of magic. With new ancient history being revealed and sharing a common enemy, The SCP Foundation decides to help these people become as great as they once were long ago.

Plus I think it’s time we get a dragon article with a happy ending!
[[/div]]
@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/voice-of-vanguard Voice of Vanguard]
//by Guezma//

Humanity must learn it's not alone in this world, and Vanguard's podcast helps spread the message. This week's guest is from Parawatch and he needs to learn a bit more than that.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/facing-forward Facing Forward]
//by Guezma//

After the events of Voice of Vanguard, Ron Gambi's life has changed, but where is it all headed? A new opportunity and an old friend will help him find his way.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/the-trainee-gets-trolled The Trainee Gets Trolled]
//by Guezma//

As part of his training in Vanguard's PR department, Ron Gambi installs Void and gets the full social media experience.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/gambi-s-gambit Gambi's Gambit]
//by Guezma//

After having been contained for two decades, Marcel Gambi is in hiding. Vanguard wants to find him to ask him a few questions. Ron Gambi wants to reunite with his long-lost brother. Unfortunately, they're not the only ones looking for him.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/ron-gambi-s-new-year-special Ron Gambi's New Year Special]
//by Guezma//

The Gambi family's New Year party is interrupted by a call from Ron's workplace. Later, Marcel spots a familiar face on TV.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/kompas-parapolityczny-na-trudne-czasy A Parapolitical Compass for These Difficult Times]
//by Jasiu06 and Ralliston//

It's not a far stretch to say we live in hard times.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/what-s-up-with-all-the-reality-benders What's Up With All the Reality Benders? — A Demographic Overview of Global Ontokinetic Prevalence]
//by Ralliston//

Why has the reality-bending population so suddenly increased following the collapse of the Veil?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/esterberg-city-wikipedia Esterberg (City) — Wikipedia]
//by Jasiu06, Jerden, MontagueETC, Ralliston, and Zygard//

More than a decade after the Veil has fallen, the world truly has changed. Let's see its true colors, this time described by a much less biased party, shall we?

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/manna-wikipedia Manna Charitable Foundation — Wikipedia]
//by EstrellaYoshte//

Who needs the SCP Foundation when you have Wikipedia?  Click the link to learn everything there is to know about the MCF in its relationship to a world without the Veil!

[[/div]]
@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/miau-miau-asheworth-kun Miau Miau, Asheworth-kun]
//by LORDXVNV//

Daniel Asheworth acclimates a colleague to the new status quo of Vanguard. Things go awry. (Also, he's a catboy, but just temporarily)
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/vikander-kneed-worldwide-news-network Vikander-Kneed Worldwide News] 
//by Cole 13//

VKTM is finally free of 50 plus years of containment by the Foundation, and in this Vanguard future, they're reaching out to the public in a big way.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/the-first-occult-flame-war The First Occult Flame War] 
//by Guezma, Ralliston and Zygard//

Imagine two faiths whose messy history goes back tens of thousands of years. Imagine them going at war and suffering unbelievable losses. Imagine them reduced to shadows of their former selves. Imagine the grudges they bear in the modern world.
Can you picture that?
Okay now put them on Twitter.
[[/div]]


@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/art:public-release-of-operation-witness-materials  Public Release of OPERATION: WITNESS Materials] 
//by Jasiu06 and Ralliston//

The times might have changed, but the GOC -- not so much. Come in and explore the Coalition's view on the un-Veiled world through their propaganda material.
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/thump-thump-tick-tock Thump Thump Tick Tock]
//by UNCGriffin//

For most people, the fall of the Veil meant waking up to a new world.  But what about those invested in the old anomalous world, and its hidden conflicts?
[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/normalcy  Normalcy] 
//by Jack Ike//

The fall of the Veil has refreshed and changed the world; but not necessarily everything within it.
[[/div]]

@@ @@
[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/the-edge-of-all-light The Edge of All Light]
//by Ralliston//

Ancient ur-gods do not really like change. But what if they were forced to adapt to our rapidly changing times? What shapes and form would they take?
[[/div]]
@@ @@

[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/the-liberal-vampire Casefile #03/12/2021-A (“The Liberal Vampire”)]
//by Ralliston//

The four Klavigars are once again on the move. What the hell are they up to?
[[/div]]
@@ @@
[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/nexus-hyperline 'Nexus HyperLine' (N7S2M/ER9C3/X56ID)]
//by Ralliston//

Normalcy might've fallen, but capitalism still sadly reigns supreme -- and Robert Carter and Skitter Marshall are going to use that fact to make some bucks.
[[/div]]
@@ @@
[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/david-hunt-on-galileo unVeiled: David Hunt on Galileo, the First Civilian Off-World Settlement]
//by Jasiu06 and Ralliston//

Shoot for the stars, kids. Don't give up if you miss, though -- the Moon might be just as good.
[[/div]]
@@ @@
[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/excerpts-from-the-galileo-deep-space-observatory Excerpts of Particular Interest From the Galileo Deep-Space Observatory Archives]
//by Aftokrator, BlazingPie, Cyvstvi, Dino--Draws, Diogene_s, DodoDevil, Ethagon, LORDXVNV, MisterFrown, Ralliston, and SynthPanda_//

If our planet is full of magic and wonder, who's to say the rest of the universe isn't as well?
[[/div]]
@@ @@
[[div class="bubble"]]
++++ [*/a-friendly-guide-to-the-katharsys-music-festival unVeiled: A Friendly Guide To The Katharsys Music Festival]
//by Uncle Nicolini and Diogene_s//

unVeiled presents a friendly guide to the first post-veilfall music festival, happening in Esterberg in 2028!
[[/div]]
@@ @@
[[div class="bubble"]]

[[<]]
[[tabview]]
[[tab What is No Return?]]
[[=]]
+++ OVERVIEW
[[/=]]
__**No Return**__ is the canon that follows on the heels of SCP-6500: Inevitable, but you already knew that right?  This canon is concerned with consequences first and foremost; when we were writing SCP-6500 it became clear that whichever timeline the reader chose, the concept of the Foundation was going to be irrevocably changed.  Which is fitting, as Inevitable is a pretty stark //climate change// allegory.  We wanted to create a setting which would foster further stories, leading off from either timeline.  

So, what is //No Return//?  It’s life after the tipping point, along two very different causal paths.  One where the Foundation maintains its iron grip on the anomalous world, but those in the know are aware SCP-6500 was the SCPF’s fault and another in which the Foundation dissolves, forming a new organization with various groups of interest (read Emissary!) to try to educate the public about the anomalous world.

------

**__Concerning Vanguard__**:

Any substantive change to the Foundation appears like an attempt to make it all more progressive but in reality, Vanguard is only interested in preserving the anomalous in light of the Impasse. Which means doing what they can to normalize the anomalous and reverse direction on a lot of Foundation policies.

Vanguard is not trying to save the world. Much of the attitude towards it being a Utopia or "//liberal wet dream//" are knee jerk responses to changes in the setting like "Vanguard can't have D-class" and "Vanguard needs to make people appreciate and like them, so they trust Vanguard enough to allow for normalization." These are __less progressive ideals and more practical solutions to try and rehabilitate the image of the Foundation__ now that Vanguard is in the public eye **and** because they want to work with GOIs where possible. GOIs who have been openly hostile to the Foundation, like the Serpent's Hand and the Nälkän peoples.


[[/tab]]
[[tab Contributing]]
This is a canon, so obviously we are open to any and all writing stories in these settings (//Threshold// or //Vanguard//) but __we ask that you read at least the paths of Inevitable that lead to the timeline you want to write for__.  Please feel free to discuss your ideas with the creators, we want a collaborative canon based on our monstrously large collaborative SCP.

**__Threshold__** is probably a little more cynical, and useful for stories about corruption within the Foundation.  
* In the Threshold Timeline, Overwatch Command when presented with the realization that their organization’s work to contain anomalies caused the slow death of all magic decided to do the bare minimum to repair the damage and continue on as before. 
* It’s effectively an open secret within this Timeline that the Foundation is responsible for the Impasse and that they are covering it up.  
* Multiple actors (including some within the Foundation) seek to out the Foundation for their part in causing SCP-6500 and bring about the downfall of the O5s, or at the very least curtail the continuing practice of containing anomalies.

**__Vanguard__** is probably a little more optimistic, and useful for stories about a new beginning and making up for past misdeeds.  
* In the Vanguard Timeline, Overwatch bowed their will to O5-Zero who proposed the Foundation dissolve and form a new organization, partnering with certain GOIs to build Vanguard.  Vanguard is an organization whose motto is //Shelter. Normalize. Inform//.  
* The goal of Vanguard is to acclimate the public to the existence of the anomalous and stop hiding the truth of this weird world.  They still intend to keep on protecting the world from dangerous anomalies, but without the amnestics, disinformation campaigns, D-Class, and other ethically distasteful activities the SCPF has gotten up to in the last century.  
* At the outset, Vanguard is made up of Ex-Foundation personnel, several Nälkä communities and Karcists, the large majority of the Serpent’s Hand and the Maxwellist Collective. //The Emissary Path is almost essential reading to grasp this new organization.//

----

[[=]]
//BUT KEEP IN MIND//: Any story is possible in either timeline.  Just have fun and don’t hesitate to ask for guidance.

For adding to this canon hub, please ask for assistance (as you can see the formatting is unique).
[[/=]]
[[/tab]]

[[tab Sister Canons]]
[[=]]
+++ Sister Canons
[[/=]]

Intimately tied into __**No Return**__ are the canons of the creators of SCP-6500:
* **[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/on-guard-43-hub | On Guard 43]]]** – concerning the cast of characters that populate Site-43, specializing in acroamatic abatement, alternative containment procedures, memetics, and one weird anomalous media company.  Focusing on witty slice of life stories, grandiose plots consisting of myriad twists and turns, the future pursuit of knowing the secrets of pataphysics through the lens of the Archetypicals, and the weird social commentary of Vikander-Kneed Technical Media.
* **[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/the-s-c-plastics-hub | S&C Plastics]]]** – concerning the personnel who staff Site-87, in the Sloth’s Pit Nexus, a town intrinsically tied to the power of narratives in more ways than one.  “It is about the people at Site-87 who have, somehow, broken free of the Foundation's ability to grind individuality, decency, humanity, and common sense into nothingness.”
* **[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/wonder-world | What a Wonderful World]]]** – This canon is mainly set in the anomalous city of Wonder World!^^TM^^, which does indeed exist on Earth as an extradimensional space somewhere in Boston, Massachusetts, United States of America. Wonder World!^^TM^^ is host, of course, to the company of Dr. Wondertainment, and to a large population (I mean, think medium sized city) of magical, Wondrous people. The culture is built on childlike innocence, willing naivety, whimsy, and a deep appreciation for the goodness that can be found in each and every person.  What a Wonderful World is not about ignoring the dark, disturbing, horribly effed up world that is the Foundationverse. It's about finding reasons to be happy and pushing through in spite of that.

Additionally, **[[[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/from-120-s-archives-hub | From 120's Archives]]]** is also tied into the Vanguard timeline.  From 120’s Archive is a modern fantasy canon focusing on the anomalous world's efforts to better itself. Almost nothing is certain – despite the ever-present gods, zealots, and horrors of the reemerging Fae Empire – except that the Foundation must work together with the anomalous, whether it likes it or not.
[[/tab]]
[[/tabview]]
[[/<]]
